result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott David Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To add credit to count 2

Defendant, Scott David Johnson, in custody, appeared with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:33)
State - files Amended Information - strike second & sub offense 
Deft - Ct 1 - second & sub. offense removed - pleads no contest
          Ct 2 - pleads no contest
Deft - waives rights & JT
Yonko - waives having PSI
State - recommends Ct 1 - 1 yr IC 2 yrs ES - concurrent to current sentence 13CF180 - Ct 2 9 mo jail concurrent to Ct 1 & concurrent sent - has credit
Yonko - deft has 203 days credit - requests ERP 

COURT:  finds pleas voluntary - finds deft guilty to Ct 1 & 2
Ct 1 - 3 yrs prison; 1 yr IC & 2 yrs ES - concurrent to current sentence 13CF180 
$268 cc
$250 dna surchg

Ct 2 - 9 months jail concurrent to Ct 1 & 13CF180
$243 cc

Not eligible for ERP - is eligible for substance abuse

Credit 203 days
TIME TO PAY
and certificate of appearance-DMS

4:00 pm Attorney Richard Louis Yonko appeared without the defendant.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Nodolf.   Vickie Girard - Clerk
Andrea Nodolf- writ in file only shows for trial date.
Court: can either reschedule it or take it up at trial. Could give preliminary ruling today - read briefs.   
Yonko - can't continue without client- would like to know ruling.
Court - Wouldn't be evidentuary hearing - Reviewed motion and conviction itself, Certainly is relevant - Court finds when going through analysis, two cases don't have a lot of similarities - Court denies other acts & evidence.
Motions in limine will be on the record also when client is present.  Standard practice - both identify witnesses.  State charges to jury. Amendment may be allowed - that's uncertain at this time. Ruled on 5, 6 is consistent with court's ruling. 
Yonko -  wants to know about state's motion.
Court - will go through analysis with client present - have you ever been convicted & how many times? is general practice.  Court asks writ be amended so Counsel has time with client.
DMS
in Limine
Defendant's brief in Opposition to the State's Motion for Introduction at Trial of Evidence of Other Acts Evidence
KMS
and certificate of appearance-DMS
and brief for the admission of other acts evidence.-stj for review
and certificate of Appearance-KS
MD

Defendant, Scott David Johnson, in custody, appeared with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Brad Erickson DOC in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:23)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
13CF180 - 
State - sentencing on both Cts 1 & 2 - argues sentence - PSI indicated 2 to 2 1/2 yrs prison doesn't believe thats enough - credit 133 days - asks for 4 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES - eligible for earned release, not eligible for challenge incar.
Yonko - goes over inaccuracies in PSI & argues sentence  - requests following the recommendation of Ct 2 - 1 yr jail remainder stayed & imposed 
Deft addresses sentencing

14CF284 -   
State - Information was filed yesterday - not showing in file or on CCAP - copy made in court
Deft waives reading & speedy jury trial

COURT:  
13CF180
Ct 1 - Prison 60 mo - 30 mo IC - 30 mo IC - credit 133 days
$268 cc - PAYMENT PLAN
Ct 2 - 12 months jail concurrent with Ct 1
$268 cc - PAYMENT PLAN
eligible for substance abuse 
not eligible for challenge incarceration
CONDITION OF ES:
assessment & follow thru
no firearms - can't vote

14CF284 - set speedy JT:   Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Scott David Johnson, in custody, appeared with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:17)  bail bond review hearing   MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Yonko - argues bond - deft has horse to take care of - is seeking inpatient or outpatient treatment - deft wasn't evading the law, he wasn't advised of probation 
Deft is being held on Child support warrant which will be done on the 7th of Nov then has cash bond
State - $2500 bond possibly on both files
Yonko - requests sign bond
State - opposes modification of bond - $2500 cash bond is appropriate - could deft be given huber to take care of horse
Deft - doesn't know if horse has been taken care of in the last month - horse needs more then an hour out on huber 

COURT:  denies modification of bond
Atty Chapman is permitted to withdraw as counsel for the defendant
to Withdraw as Counsel

set Motion & Prelim in 14CF284 - 45 minutes
set sentencing hearing in 13CF180 in 60 days set 12-16-14 at 3:00*****  Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
